name: Quality Management
relatedProcesses: Internal Audit, Document Control, Management Review

criteria.description: Quality policy is documented and communicated
Quality objectives are defined and measurable
Roles and responsibilities are clearly defined
External and internal issues relevant to the organization's purpose have been determined
Interested parties and their requirements have been identified
The scope of the quality management system is defined and available
Top management provides evidence of commitment to quality management system development and implementation
The organization has established a process for risk-based thinking and risk assessment
There is a systematic approach to identifying and addressing organizational risks and opportunities
Quality management system documentation is comprehensive and up-to-date
There is a clear process for reviewing and updating quality objectives periodically
The organization has established methods to communicate quality objectives across all levels
There are defined processes for internal communication related to quality management
Competence requirements for personnel are clearly defined and documented
A process exists for maintaining and retaining documented information
The organization has established a systematic approach to knowledge management
There is a process for monitoring and measuring the effectiveness of quality management system
Internal audit processes are comprehensive and cover all key quality management areas
Management review meetings comprehensively address quality management system performance
A robust process exists for identifying and implementing continuous improvement opportunities
Processes are systematically defined
Process performance is monitored
Continuous improvement mechanisms exist
Process interactions and sequence are documented
Process resources and responsibilities are clearly defined
Risks and opportunities for each process have been addressed
Process inputs and expected outputs are clearly defined and documented
Measurement and monitoring methods for process performance are established
Process control mechanisms ensure consistent and predictable results
Process variability is tracked and analyzed systematically
Clear criteria and methods are defined to ensure effective process operation
Process documentation includes clear work instructions and procedures
Process control strategies address potential non-conformities and their prevention
Performance indicators (KPIs) for each process are established and tracked
Processes are reviewed and updated based on performance data and feedback
Process control includes validation and verification of process capabilities

name: Management Responsibility
relatedProcesses: Quality Management, Internal Audit, Management Review

criteria.description: Business planning process is well-documented
Management review meetings are regularly conducted
Strategic objectives are clearly defined and communicated
Top management demonstrates leadership and commitment to QMS
Organizational roles support quality management system effectiveness
Top management has established a quality policy that is appropriate to the organization's purpose and context
Quality policy provides a framework for setting quality objectives
Management ensures that quality responsibilities and authorities are assigned and communicated within the organization
Top management considers the needs and expectations of interested parties in the quality management system
The organization has a defined process for managing organizational knowledge and ensuring its availability
Top management ensures integration of quality management system requirements into the organization's business processes
There is a systematic approach to risk-based thinking and opportunity identification across the organization
Management review includes evaluation of opportunities for improvement and need for changes to the quality management system
The organization has a clear communication strategy for quality objectives and performance
Top management promotes a process approach and risk-based thinking throughout the organization

name: Resource Management
relatedProcesses: Quality Management, Internal Audit, Human Resources

criteria.description: Human resource processes are well-defined
Training programs are comprehensive and tracked
Facilities and equipment maintenance is systematic
Document and data control processes are robust
Resources needed for QMS establishment and maintenance are determined
Competence of persons doing work affecting quality is ensured
A systematic approach to determining and providing necessary resources for QMS implementation exists
Personnel are aware of the relevance and importance of their activities in achieving quality objectives
The organization has established a process for identifying and addressing workforce training needs
Records of education, training, skills, and experience are maintained for personnel
Infrastructure support for process operations is adequately planned and maintained
Environment for the operation of processes is monitored and managed
Measurement and monitoring resources are calibrated, verified, and maintained at regular intervals
The organization ensures the availability of appropriate resources for monitoring and measuring
Knowledge management processes are established to retain and share organizational knowledge
Organizational competence is systematically assessed and improved

name: Measurement Analysis and Improvement
relatedProcesses: Quality Management, Internal Audit, Continuous Improvement

criteria.description: Financial processes (Accounting) are well-controlled
Legal and risk management processes are effective
Internal auditing processes are comprehensive
Data analysis processes cover multiple domains
Monitoring and measurement are established to ensure conformity to product requirements
Internal audit processes are established to evaluate QMS effectiveness
Corrective action processes are established to address nonconformity
Performance indicators are defined, measured, and analyzed systematically
Customer feedback and satisfaction data are collected and analyzed regularly
Trend analysis is performed to identify potential improvements and prevent recurring issues
Nonconformity root cause analysis is conducted systematically
Process performance data is used for strategic decision-making
Statistical methods are used to analyze and improve process performance
Management review includes a comprehensive analysis of organizational performance metrics
There is a clear process for identifying and prioritizing improvement opportunities
Effectiveness of corrective and preventive actions is systematically evaluated
External audit findings are tracked and addressed systematically
Customer satisfaction measurement is systematic
Vendor relations are professionally managed
Marketing strategies are aligned with business objectives
Market research is conducted to determine customer requirements
Customer communication processes are established
Marketing communication materials are consistent with organizational quality policy
Customer feedback mechanisms are comprehensive and regularly reviewed
Marketing team has clear processes for evaluating and responding to customer needs
Competitive analysis and market positioning are systematically performed
Digital marketing and online presence align with organization's brand and quality standards
Marketing performance metrics are defined, tracked, and analyzed
Product or service positioning reflects accurate and verifiable information
Marketing strategy includes mechanisms for continuous improvement based on market feedback
Risk management processes are integrated into marketing strategy development
Marketing team demonstrates awareness of and compliance with legal and regulatory requirements
RFQ and quotation processes are well-defined
Order review and entry processes are rigorous
Design and change control processes are documented
Tendering processes are established to ensure accurate and complete information
Contract review processes are established to ensure requirements are met
Project management methodology is clearly defined and consistently applied
Risk assessment and mitigation strategies are integrated into project planning
Customer requirements are systematically captured and validated throughout the sales process
Project communication plans are established and maintained
Performance metrics for sales and project success are defined and tracked
Proposal development process includes comprehensive review and approval stages
Customer interaction and feedback mechanisms are integrated into project lifecycle
Post-project review and lessons learned process is systematically implemented
Resource allocation and project staffing processes are well-documented
Cost estimation and financial tracking processes are robust and transparent
Purchase order process is systematic
Supplier management process is comprehensive
Subcontractor activities are well-monitored
Supplier selection and evaluation processes are established
Purchasing information is accurate and complete
Procurement strategy aligns with organizational quality and strategic objectives
Procurement risk management processes are comprehensive and proactive
Supplier performance metrics are systematically tracked and analyzed
Procurement documentation and records are maintained and controlled
Supplier communication and relationship management processes are clearly defined
Cost management and price negotiation strategies are systematic and transparent
Procurement compliance with legal and regulatory requirements is ensured
Supplier diversity and sustainability considerations are integrated into procurement processes
Emergency and alternative sourcing strategies are established
Technology and digital tools are effectively used to streamline procurement processes
Inventory management is precise and tracked
Quality control processes are robust
Product nonconformity and RMA processes are well-defined
Storage and preservation processes are established to prevent damage
Inventory control processes are established to ensure accurate tracking
Warehouse layout and organization optimize space utilization and workflow efficiency
Temperature and environmental controls are established for sensitive inventory
Cycle counting and periodic inventory reconciliation processes are systematic
Digital inventory management systems are integrated and provide real-time tracking
Safety protocols and equipment maintenance for warehouse operations are comprehensive
Pick, pack, and shipping processes are standardized and traceable
Returns and reverse logistics processes are clearly defined and efficiently managed
Barcoding or RFID tracking systems are implemented for inventory accuracy
Stock rotation methods (e.g., FIFO, LIFO) are consistently applied
Emergency and disaster recovery plans for inventory are established
Design and change control processes are documented
Specifications and drawings are maintained accurately
Production processes are established to ensure conformity to product requirements
Process validation is performed to ensure conformity to product requirements
Manufacturing equipment is regularly calibrated and maintained to ensure accuracy and precision
Quality control checkpoints are integrated throughout the manufacturing process
Manufacturing work instructions are clear, accessible, and up-to-date
Material traceability processes are established and consistently implemented
Production planning considers resource availability, capacity, and potential constraints
Worker competence and training requirements for each manufacturing process are clearly defined
Non-conforming product identification, segregation, and disposition processes are robust
Statistical process control techniques are used to monitor and improve manufacturing performance
Tools, fixtures, and measuring equipment are systematically verified and maintained
Manufacturing processes include clear procedures for handling customer-specific requirements
Post-production testing and inspection processes are comprehensive and documented
Goods delivery process is reliable and tracked
Delivery performance metrics are monitored
Transportation processes are established to ensure safe and secure delivery
Packaging and labeling processes are established to prevent damage
Vehicle maintenance and fleet management processes are systematic
Route optimization strategies are implemented to improve efficiency
Driver performance and safety training programs are established
Transportation risk management processes cover potential disruptions and contingencies
Real-time tracking and communication systems are integrated into transportation operations
Compliance with transportation regulations and legal requirements is consistently maintained
Third-party work is clearly defined and controlled
Outsourced services meet quality standards
External providers are evaluated based on their ability to meet requirements
Type and extent of control for external providers is determined
Comprehensive subcontractor qualification and onboarding process exists
Performance metrics and KPIs for subcontractors are systematically tracked and reviewed
Clear communication channels and escalation procedures with subcontractors are established
Risk assessment and mitigation strategies for subcontractor-related activities are documented
Confidentiality and data protection agreements are in place for all subcontractors
Periodic performance reviews and continuous improvement mechanisms for subcontractors are implemented
Supplier qualification process is comprehensive and well-documented
Supplier performance evaluation criteria are clearly defined
Risk assessment process for suppliers is established
Supplier selection process considers quality, cost, and delivery capabilities
Regular supplier performance reviews are conducted
Corrective action processes for supplier nonconformities are established
Supplier communication channels are clear and effective
Supplier quality management system compliance is verified
Supplier confidentiality and data protection measures are in place
Supplier training and development programs are evaluated
Supplier contract terms include quality and performance expectations
Supplier innovation and continuous improvement are encouraged
Supplier financial stability and business continuity are assessed
Environmental and sustainability criteria are considered in supplier evaluation
Supplier complaint and feedback mechanisms are established

name: Management Review
relatedProcesses: Quality Management, Internal Audit, Continuous Improvement

criteria.description: Previous management review actions have been followed up
Changes in external and internal issues relevant to the quality management system have been reviewed
Information on the performance and effectiveness of the quality management system is available
Customer feedback and satisfaction levels have been analyzed
Process performance and product conformity have been evaluated
Nonconformities and corrective actions have been reviewed
Results of internal and external audits have been discussed
Performance of external providers has been evaluated
Resource needs and adequacy have been assessed
Effectiveness of actions to address risks and opportunities has been evaluated
Improvement opportunities have been identified
Quality objectives and their achievement have been reviewed
Strategic direction and potential need for changes to the quality management system have been discussed
Recommendations for improvement have been developed
Communication effectiveness within the organization has been assessed
